item.description:
Tired of the same old brunch standbys like quiche and mimosas? How about something completely different -- like
crispy wontons layered with scallions, pear and flambeed shrimp, or crepes filled with sweet, spicy satay? Let's take a culinary journey to your choice of Cambodia or France, by way of the Waltham Elephant Walk. . . conveniently located near Waltham's Embassy Cinema, which offers a number of interesting films for our afternoon entertainment.
There's a three course prix fixe brunch for $20, or you can pick and choose individual dishes and have a great meal for approximately $12-$15. Check out the brunch menu on the restaurant web site for more info. (And if you're interested in a movie, you can click here to see the featured films for Sunday.)

If you don't have a car (we know some members don't) we may be able to help you get a ride out to Waltham. . . as long as you are also interested in staying on for a movie. Email us to discuss further before you RSVP.

Your $2 reservation fee will be added to the tip for our table.
item.name: Brunch at Elephant Walk (and maybe a movie after)
